name: Excalibur Hotel & Casino

reviews.text: Rooms spacious, clean and comfortable, bathroom large, shower great. Hotel impersonal but this is Vegas, kids area great and they actually win cuddly toys. Pools brilliant including an adults only one, but in May pools restricted midweek all only open at weekends. Hotel located at top of the strip lots of walking but close to amenities, staff helpful enough but found the sales guys selling trips located in the foyer a flipping nuisance. Everyone expects tips and large tips, one taxi driver shouted abuse at us for only giving him $2 extra. Lots of different restaurants within the hotel, mcdonalds, costa, sandwich bar, buffets, pizza. Also gift shops located inside. A lot of walking in this hotel and all the others but child friendly and good on a budget.
reviews.title: great for families

reviews.text: A Sunday to Wednesday stay for about $30 a night was very good. Quite nice modern room and large casino. I hated $15 Resort Fee but that is endemic at the larger hotels. The entire cluster of MGM hotels is a nice place to base your visit.
reviews.title: Excalibur Yes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value for those on a budget.love the adults only pool although it is bit on the small size.the entertainment is sadly lacking the female group in the lounge bar area are dire.rooms need updating but are a generous size.good gaming facilities.check in quick considering the long lines.exit moving walkkways out of order which seems to be the norm for this hotel
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Our room smelled like a sewer. And the $15 resort fee is incredibly annoying. The wifi the resort fee supposedly gives you isn't wireless and our iPad and iPhone wasn't compatable with the wire for the wifi. Excalibur has okay service. We got a lot of our money back after complaining and only had to end up paying $41.44 for double beds, non smoking in tower two. We had to call customer service twice because they didn't change the bill. I suggest staying in tower two because it was recently renovated and from what I here tower 1 needs updating. The air conditioner worked nicely and the bathroom was spacious. The beds and pillows were comfortable. All in all it was just okay.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere

reviews.text: It has become a tradition for my family to stay at Excalibur hotel everytime we travel to Las Vegas. I love that it looks like a castle on the outside.
reviews.title: I love staying here!!

reviews.text: My room was fine, seemed to be clean. It was nothing fancy, but I wasn't planning on spending a lot of time in the room. We were charged a resort fee...there was no wifi in the rooms...only wired internet access. The people downstairs in the casino area got on my nerves trying to stop us to offer "free" comps everytime we walked by.
reviews.title: My room was ok...My friends had a thief in the night!

reviews.text: My friends stayed in another room in tower 2 and were awakened by security on Thursday morning to tell them of a problem with their door. They looked around to discover that someone had taken a tablet and cash while they were sleeping! Needless to say this was very alarming to know that someone was able to just walk into their room. They have no security cameras in the hallways either. The hotel was going to do an investigation and let them know what they found out in a few days.
reviews.title: The hotel room was clean and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my title states, it's a luxury to have a quiet hotel room on Las Vegas Blvd! I only stayed one night, did not use the resort, but I enjoyed a good night sleep. I came to Las Vegas to work and bought a night at the hotel through Southwest Airlines. At the price it was a good deal, a zillion times better than the Quad Hotel and Casino, where I'm staying now, extremely noisy room, I don't think I'll be able to sleep tonight. If you get one of those airline/hotel deals I think the Excalibur is an excellent choice.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Excalibur was part of our package with Spirit Airlines. I was aware of the $15 resort fee... did not realize that it was also taxed. The website advertised free wi-fi, but it was only wired internet. I had to go to the Apple store and purchase a $29 ethernet adaptor... and since iphones are always using data, I was receiving messages from AT&T that my phone was nearing my data limit. I went to the computer center to print our boarding passes. It took me 30 seconds to pull them up, but the printer would not work. Computer use charge for 10 minutes is $5 cash or $6.95 card. I asked for help from three people, all said they would get help and be back. I waited and had to pay for another 10 minutes... no one came. I called the 'help line' and was told to leave a message. Those 10 minutes ticked away and Spirit Airlines timed out on my boarding passes. When I went to the front desk, in tears, for help, they said the concierge would print them... would have been nice to know. The $20 food and beverage credit was only good at their steakhouse or restaurants at the Luxor. The moving walkway was out of service the whole 6 days we were there. Heads up to guests: their box office charges a service fee for tickets, tix4tonight does not. The accommodations were fine, other than having to wait until after 3 one day for our room to be cleaned. We did not notice until the 4th day that sheets are only changed upon request. It's just frustrating when things are advertised one way and you end up spending time and money to get it right. It's an okay place to be if you don't expect much more than a bed...
reviews.title: Great time in Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Excalibur for a friends wedding in April. The hotel room was in tower 2 and was nice size for me and my husband with a nice view of the strip. We could see New York New York hotel and was very pretty at nice when everything lit up. Gambled alittle at the hotel and won alittle ... Wasn't really there to gamble so we didn't focus alot on it.
reviews.title: last resort

reviews.text: We spent one night here in June with our two grandsons. When we checked in we requested a fridge and were told $25 no exceptions. When we explained that it was needed to store medication for one of our grandsons the clerk checked with a manager and returned and said that they would let us have one for $10 - a nice touch. The first room we were given was in such bad repair with peeling wall paper, clogged plumbing and standing water in the bathroom sink that even the bell boy was shocked and he personally called the front desk and got us moved to a decent room. The manager also comped us the $15 resort fee to make up for the experience, so I give the staff a big thumbs up.
reviews.title: Room was good once we were moved to it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second room was fine with two queen beds, large bathroom, safe and plenty of room. The view was so-so but no big deal. Now staying here is convenient for the strip but having to walk through the smoke infested casino every time to get to the room towers is really a bad thing.
reviews.title: Excalibur- great hotel!

reviews.text: We did make use of the food court to have a somewhat cheap breakfast that we took back to the room. There are several options in the court like Starbucks , McDonalds, Krispy Kreme donuts etc. Be warned that an item that costs you $2 at home will be closer to $4 here.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.text: Overall the room was fine, walking through the smoke filled casino was not so great, and the food court offered some cheaper eating options. Access to the strip is good.
reviews.title: GREAT,GREAT,GREAT!

reviews.text: I've heard before the Excalibur in Vegas was just 'fair'...I have a Vegas rule about not staying in the same hotel twice so gave the Excalibur a try....I have heard in the past it caters more to kids like Circus Circus however the deal could not be passed up. We checked in on a Sunday and got a 'fair' room...it was small and standard but would do....the next morning my boyfriend called the front desk and asked about upgrading to a parlour suite because it was his birthday we did and got it for half price for the next 3 nights! If you can get your hands on a deal like this try it! The suites were AWESOME! The hotel itself is nice, great theme and spacious. Its connected to New York New York by the outside walkway, connected to Luxor by the inside and connected to Luxor and Mandalay Bay by the tram.
reviews.title: Nice With a great price tag
Don’t expect a good night’s sleep or internet access
reviews.text: The Excalibur really isn’t that special but it was cheap. Check in was extremely slow, over 45 minutes but that is the norm at most Vegas Hotels. The $15 additional “resort fee” is a joke. The rooms were ok. The carpet was an awful burnt orange color and really stained, frayed and showing age. The walls are paper thin; I could hear my neighbors laughing all night until 4am. The room faced the airport and you could hear planes taking off. There is no wifi in the rooms. They provide a wired connection but it never worked. The bathroom was huge but again, showing age with a shower that would randomly have water leaking out of it. If walking is a problem, especially with your luggage, definitely do the valet as the parking garage is not connected to the hotel or casino. To get to the hotel/casino from the self-parking garage, you have to walk through a surface parking lot. There are plenty of food options in the food court. The pool area is really nice with 4 pools (although one was closed). There is a slide, waterfalls and hot tubs. The pool area is the best and nicest feature about this place. If you want to get by on the cheap and have a nice pool area, this place is for you.

reviews.title: Nice Stay
reviews.text: I have reviewed this as five star based on what I consider important in a holiday hotel and the price we paid. Two things that usually let accommodation down for me are the showers and the air conditioning, both excellent here. the beds and pillows were also excellent, some of the best nights sleep i've had. add to that an excellent daily maid service, with clean towels and bedding, what more could anyone want. would definately stay here again

reviews.title: Good location on the strip
reviews.text: I stayed at Excalibur for 3 nights. I stayed in Tower 1 on the 23rd floor and it is dated, but clean and functional. The room had 2 beds, very comfortable with great pillows! The bathroom could use updating but it was clean and that's really all that mattered to me. Toiletries were replenished every day. The room has a small safe. The walls are thin and we could often hear the conversations of our neighbours but it didn't really bother us.

reviews.title: What you pay is what you get
reviews.text: For the price and the location on the south end of The Strip it's a really good choice.

reviews.title: King For A Day
reviews.text: The real downer is the resort fee, and when you factor this in to the total cost you may be able to stay at a nicer hotel for a comparable price.
rooms are very clean and food is good we love to stay here
reviews.title: vacation

reviews.text: The worst hotel . Dirty rooms , loby etc . I made the reservation thru SouthWest Airlines and end paying twice Excaliber Hotel bill me twice claiming that the room price is $120.00 per night I prefer sleeping on the street. Checking into our room took hours
reviews.title: Worst Hotel You get what you paid For.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Excalibur May 19, 20, and 21, 2012 for my wedding with 3 other family members. We were given rooms in Tower 2 on the 19th Floor. Debbie at the front desk was extremely helpful and check in was a breeze. We all thought our rooms were decorated nicely and were very clean. I wish I had had a room closer to the elevator but oh well!!! We saw Fantasy next door at Luxor. Not my favorite but the guys enjoyed it.... The Tournament of Kings was fun! Eat at Lynyrd Skynyrd if you stay here....it was awesome!!! The hotel did seem unusually crowded and there were children everywhere (including casino floor) which seemed kinda crazy!!!! Overall we had no complaints- we all would stay here again. We had a blast at the Excalibur!!!
reviews.title: Better Than We Expected!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino is on the 'tacky' side, however, the rooms have been renovated since we were last there and are very clean and comfortable. I would reccommend, however, that you put towels on floor and card on bed to get linen changed, as they are not done otherwise, unlike most hotels.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: The location is good if you are happy and able to walk long distances. The casino could do with an update and I had forgotten until walking into the reception what it is like to be in a smoking venue.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely fine, the rooms were clean and comfortable and we managed to get it for a great price.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: There were 4 pools which were always very busy though we were there over the weekend.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.text: The gaming floor is very 'retro' and the entertainment is a bit on the poor side but there are so many other hotels around offering entertainment I wouldn't let this put you off.
reviews.title: Not great service, Expensive additional fees, HORRIBLE Valet

reviews.text: Excalibur is south of the strip but you can buy a 24hr ticket on the deuce bus which will, slowly, take you up an down the strip. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes on a bus coming so it was a good way to get around without having to walk up and down the strip in the unbearable heat!  Easy walking to New York New York, MGM Grand, Luxor and Mandalay Bay.
reviews.title: Typical...and a Bit Inconvenient

reviews.text: We didn't really eat in the hotel as all it had to offer was fast food. There was one Italian restaurant but the queue was always absolutely massive.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: I recently made a three night trip to Vegas and stayed at the Excalibur for the firts time. The proximity to the convention at Mandalay Bay and the sky tram between the two hotels was the draw.
reviews.title: Tower One room 25th floor

reviews.text: The rate was good. Check in efficient. Room, while older was clean. The bed was comfy. New Large flatscreen TV. Hallways pretty quiet. Don't eat here. Better restaurants at NYNY and Mandalay Bay. They did give us three free drinks each for our Resort Fee of 16.00 per night.
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.text: I would stay here again just for the convenient location for the JCK Vegas show I attended. But I do prefer the other end of the Strip.
reviews.title: NOT a Fan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have only called to make a group reservation for 20+ rooms and was met with a rude attitude and am inattentive sales person from the very beginning. There is a long list of automated prompts to get to the correct person, and when the call was finally answered after a long hold, she was asking for an account number that I obviously did not have as this was my first time calling. Obviously their sales people pull a double duty, but you would think there was a way to differentiate the calls so you are not causing the guest to doubt that they have called the correct department. Then when asking about their group rates, the sales person said, "Just go online and look at our rates, and that is what we will book you at." If you aren't offering a group discount for guaranteed contracted business, that is fine, but at least have the decency to offer me the rates instead of telling ME to go online and look them up. I am not impressed with the people who are supposed to be ambassadors for the property and we will not be bringing them our business. I would not suggest that anyone else do either. If they treat you this way on the phone before you have booked, once they have your money, is it fair to expect them to treat you any better? I think not!
reviews.title: great for the price - nice atmosphere

reviews.text: While I have never stayed at the Excalibur (and from what I hear, I'm not missing much), I always stay at neighboring casinos. I am an Mlife member, and this end of the strip has the most to offer me. During my several visits to Las Vegas, I have always (usually by process of elimination) stumbled into this casino at some point during my first 24 hours of the trip. After this last visit, I will NEVER stop here again.
reviews.title: Great stay!
Theft from Room
reviews.text: We returned to our room at 1:53 am only to be awakened at 6:13 by a phone call from Security. My purse had been stolen from our room while we were sleeping along with a new Ipad.The purse had apparently been found in the hall. We immediately went to security to identify my purse only to find that $1100 in cash had been taken. The hotel maintains that our door was opened at 1:20 with one of the keys issued to us and closed at 5:54. Both times are incorrect. According to them our door was not secure. We had a cot in our room which would make access to the dresser difficult in the dark unless the room had been cased earlier. In addition we were advised by Security that there should be a sticker on the door with instructions for the use of the deadbolt. There was no sticker or instructions. There are no cameras in the hall and if the halls are patrolled by Security they are not looking for unsecure doors. We were in Tower 2 and no keys are checked by Security before you use the elevators and in addition it would be very easy for the intruder to use the elevator and exit by the door going to the pool. I have searched the internet and found that there are other cases of thefts while guests are sleeping. Losing money is one thing, but when you think that someone has entered your room it is very alarming. I will not let this matter rest. I will be staying at another hotel in future and be checking their security.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reserved a $20 room special which with taxes, fees, etc became $50. Checked in about 11 PM on a Wednesday night, went to our room, had baggage sent up, headed back downstairs, almost all the bars on the casino floor were closed. Tried the Lounge, waited 15 minutes, waitress took order from another couple, ignored us, we left. Took the walkway across to New York, New York and had a Hard Cider and a Guinness at the Irish Pub with live music. Headed back to the Excalibur about 1;30 AM, got to our room on the 24th floor and neither of our key cards worked. Head back to the lobby, waited in line for 15 minutes, got to the reservation counter, clerk just scolded at us, replaced the cards, never said sorry or anything. Next morning we went down to get some breakfast, went back to the room, tried calling the front desk to get a bellman to assist with the bags, spent 25 minutes on hold listening to commercials. Gave up, went back downstairs to the bell service counter, they said they would send someone up right away and they did.
reviews.title: Reasonable room, poor front desk, $20 room turns into $50 room

reviews.text: Except for the Bell Staff, customer service at the Excalibur is non existent.
reviews.title: Compared to the Imperial Palace , this place was the "Ritz"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Favorite Aunt and I recently stayed @the Excalibur for 5 days 4 nights. We stayed in tower 2 , 11th floor, a non- smoking room. The room was comfortable , clean , and decorated nicely with comfy beds and great maid service. The bathroom was roomy and updated with new fixtures and well lit. The water pressure for the shower was weak , but doable . It was easy to see that The Excalibur was a older casino , and not in the center of the strip. No coffee pot in the room and a cup of coffee is about three bucks in the lobby . Get around that by bringing your own pot ( I brought one that boils water , and used instant coffee, a big money saver ) . No wifi or mini fridge , but no big deal either. The casino floor needed some updating , but there was plenty of security staff around and helpful hotel employees.On the second floor of the casino are plenty of places to eat , including a Crispy Kreme , Cinnabon , McDonald's, Popeye's Chicken, Asian , Italian and a all you can eat buffet , that serves breakfast and dinner , plus a steakhouse , which was very good. There was also a Dairy Queen and a yogurt land. Those that have complained about the smoke smell ...... your in a casino , you can't get away from that or those resort fees. I would definitely stay there again AND would recommend it to others. Thank You Excalibur, for a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Excalibur was part of a package deal recommended by our travel agent. We were astonished at the great price for the package deal and jumped on it. The Excalibur is one of the older hotels on the strip and in need of some upgrades. No Wifi in the rooms. No room service after hours. No mini bar, no mini fridge, not even a coffee pot, no frills at all. But if you are looking for a decent room where you plan to do little more than sleep, while taking in the "Vegas Experience", then this is the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Great value great buffet Will be back again and again

description: Camelot-inspired Hotel with 4 towers & storybook-style "castle" gates, multicolored spires & a modified medieval theme.
